answerText: gel electrophoresis [or agarose gel electrophoresis; or SDS-PAGE; prompt on "electrophoresis"; prompt on "running a gel"][10] A dye containing ethidium and a negatively charged ion of this element is used to visualize nucleic acids in agarose gel electrophoresis, and fluoresces red-orange under UV light.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2015 | Chattahoochee HS + Columbia B + Toronto B | 1 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This general technique is used to separate macromolecules by size and charge. For 10 points each: [10] Name this laboratory technique in which samples are placed in a matrix of agarose or polyacrylamide, through which a current is run.
